titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Paul Stephen Galatowitsch Papers
titlestmt.author: compiled by Robert Bartels

publicationstmt.publisher: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Tuesday April 16, 2019 at 07:00

repository.corpname: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

did.abstract: The Paul Stephen Galatowitsch papers consist of research files documenting the AIDS crisis and AIDS response in New Haven in the 1980s and 1990s.

scopecontent.head: Content Description
scopecontent.p: The Paul Stephen Galatowitsch papers consist of research files documenting AIDS and AIDS response in New Haven in the 1980s and 1990s. Material includes subject files, interview transcripts, reports related to local AIDS public policy and interventions, papers and presentations, and news clippings and research bibliographies compiled or written by Galatowitsch for his 1996 Yale dissertation, "An Institutional, Organizational, and Cultural Analysis of New Haven, Connecticut's Response to the AIDS Epidemic, 1980-1991."

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The material is arranged as received from the donor.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Paul Stephen Galatowitsch papers (MS 2085). Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright has been transferred to Yale University for unpublished materials authored or otherwise produced by the creator(s) of this collection. Copyright status for other collection materials is unknown. Transmission or reproduction of materials protected by U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) beyond that allowed by fair use requires the written permission of the copyright owners. Works not in the public domain cannot be commercially exploited without permission of the copyright owners. Responsibility for any use rests exclusively with the user.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Paul Stephen Galatowitsch received a PhD in Organizational and Institutional Sociology from Yale University in 1996. His dissertation was titled "An Institutional, Organizational, and Cultural Analysis of New Haven, Connecticut's Response to the AIDS Epidemic, 1980-1991." Dr. Galatowitsch specializes in the study of institutional, cultural, and political responses to illness and disease, in particular responses to HIV and AIDS.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The papers are open for research.

Original born digital files, as well as preservation masters, may not be accessed due to their fragility. Researchers must consult use copies, or if none exist request that they be made. Born digital files cannot be accessed remotely. System requirements include a Manuscripts and Archives computer and file viewing software.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Original audiovisual materials, as well as preservation and duplicating masters, may not be played. Researchers must consult use copies, or if none exist must pay for a use copy, which is retained by the repository. Researchers wishing to obtain an additional copy of non-commercially produced items for their personal use should consult the ordering reproductions information on the Manuscripts and Archives web site.
